page.title: 03EDUCATION - HOLLIERS FARM
page.content: Holliers is situated in the N.E. corner of our area in the fertile Arreton valley. Owned by the Isle of Wight County Council, it is used by the College of Arts and Technology for vocational training in farming to higher education students. It is operated on a commercial basis and is expected to be profit-making. A mixed farm, it covers 80 acres divided into 10 fields, 3 of which are permanent pasture. Crops, barley, wheat and ryegrass are rotated on a 3-year cycle. In 1985 18 sows, serviced by 1 boar, are expected to produce 300 - 350 piglets; 40 calves are bought each year and a flock of 3 rams, 100 ewes and at present 140 lambs are kept. These are reared to be sold to the meat market.
